name: Hotel Valide Sultan Konagi

reviews.text: I stayed very recently at the hotel, and we stayed there because of its good rating and good prices but would go back because of its very friendly and helpful staff. Great location in Sultanahmet area as well. And we didn't mind the fantastic views at breakfast either!
reviews.title: Great value and wonderful and helpful staff.

reviews.text: We were a party of 3 having 2 rooms and loved our stay here. The rooms are small, but since the hotel is so marvelously located we were mostly out and about. The size of the rooms is compensated by the lovely outdoor patio, where we rested amid the roses between excursions and sipped delightful cay elma. The staff were wonderful. Special thanks to Bunyamin, Ramazan, Mahmud and young Benjamin at breakfast.
reviews.title: Valide Sultan became our home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved it so much that we came back to bid goodbye and had our final supper on the delightful Terrace, with its view of the Aya Sofia. We hope to come back.
reviews.title: Great mid price range hotel, ideal location, helpful staff

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our time at the Hotel Valide Sultan Konagi. Great location, helpful staff, comfortable and clean rooms - no complaints, really!
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, best breakfast ever, small rooms

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is very yummy as well with all kinds of Turkish delights. Rambo, the server at the restaurant deserves a special mention. He was very kind and helpful - a real stand out employee!
reviews.title: Great location-near all the important sites

reviews.text: We stayed in Valide Sultan Hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of our trip and 2 nights at the end of the trip. The hotel is perfectly located in Sultanahmet. The staff was very friendly. I arrived around 7 am before my friend and there were not any rooms available. They said it will not be ready until 11 am or so.
reviews.title: Great Location and Charming Room

reviews.text: While I was waiting in the lobby, the receptionist brought me tea. Then he said that the breakfast is ready and I should go have breakfast! That was really kind of him considering breakfast was not included in the room price for that morning. I went to have breakfast and I was pleasantly surprised. The view was amazing! I sat at the terrace overlooking Sultanahmet while the sun is rising. It was beautiful. The breakfast was really good and we enjoyed it everyday.
reviews.title: Comfortable, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First room we stayed in was the room with the canopy bed. It was good, clean and a bit small though. At the end of our stay, we had a room in the basement and it was nice as well. The washroom was newer and bigger than the one we previously stayed in.
reviews.title: Room 309 has an amazing view of the bosporus and topkapi palace's courtyard

reviews.text: Overall, it is a nice hotel with a great location. It is in the center of all the attractions yet it is very quiet at night. Staff is helpful and friendly but gives a bit more attention to women travelers which could be annoying sometimes. You will be offered a lot of tea every time you come in!
reviews.title: Turkish hospitality at its best plus great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent 10 days with my parents in Istambul and we had a very good time in Valide Sultan Hotel. Rooms are small, but very clean and comfortable. Location is absolutely perfect, one minute from Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia, 5 min from tram, restaurants, shops and cafes. The restaurant on the rooftop is simple, but the view is amazing. The staff is friendly and helpful, but a bit too interested in chatting with young female guests. The breakfast was okay, but everyday there was less things offered than the day before.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very good small hotel 100 steps from Topkapi and maybe 200 from Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque... rooms and breakfat OK, view from the higher floors (including restaurant) really amazing
reviews.title: great position

reviews.text: the reception staff is very friendly but will try to sell you every possible extra-service, if possible use only official guides
reviews.title: DON'T MAKE THE MISTAKE!!!

reviews.text: -The photos are deceiving...the rooms are TINY and incredibly outdated!!!
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: IF YOU ARE TRAVELLING WITH 3 people - the 3 person room is a JOKE. They are small for even 2 people.
reviews.title: JUST GREAT!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The location while it's "close" to things...is VERY VERY busy. It's right next to where the tour busses drop off millions of people to see the Topkapi palace, and there's a taxi station right there. VERY noisy.
reviews.title: Practically Perfect - Great price, food, location, staff, & room

reviews.text: The good: this 17 room boutique hotel has an excellent location, next to Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia. Walking distance to everything in Old Town. Hotel has been nicely remodeled, staff is pleasant, breakfast very good, terrace has a nice view.
reviews.title: Good 'n bad

reviews.text: The bad: if staying in the shoulder season be aware that the hotel owners are parsimonious in the use of air conditioning. Therefore one must open the windows at night. It is very noisy: sound reverberates off the old Palace walls, there is a bar and youth hostel next door, traffic noise, dog packs and, of course, the 4:30AM call to prayer over the loudspeakers of at least 6 mosques in the neighborhood which goes on for about 20 minutes. If you are traveling in the spring/fall and noise bothers you, best try some place else.
reviews.title: Happy We Found It

reviews.text: After having a bad experience at a nearby hotel (room confirmed was unavailable at 2:30 a.m. upon arrival), we set out to find another place to stay nearby. We loved the large Hotel Valide Sultan Konagi from the outside...it is on a corner just a block from the entrance to Topkapi. There were two rooms available, one in the basement with no view and one an apartment next door to the hotel. While some of the furnishings were a little the worse for wear, we were amazed at how large the apartment was, how airy and comfortable. We only needed one bedroom, so the other one was locked. We had a large living room with a sink/fridge, and a small balcony overlooking the road (lots of tour buses), Topkapi's wall, and the sea. The fact that we were next to such a busy street didn't matter---our bedroom was in the back and had an air conditioner, so we did not hear any noise. Breakfast was lovely--on the top floor of the hotel, with a charming man taking care of our food. Lovely view of the Bosphorus.....
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable hotel, beautiful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The man at the desk was chatty and friendly, although he pushed the tours a bit too much. But once we let him know that we were not interested, he remained helpful and friendly. All in all, a very pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: This is was my 5th trip to Istanbul, and my first time staying at this hotel. The hotel is located between the Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Place. Everything is within a short walking distance. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable. The breakfast on the rooftop restaurant was a very good Turkish breakfast and Ramazan "Rambo", goes out of his way to help you understand what some of the "unfamiliar items are on the buffet table. The view from the rooftop was stunning, a great way to start out every morning! The front desk staff was very helpful.
reviews.title: best location

description: Hotel Valide Sultan Konagi is proud to serve those guests who prize the unique ambience and charm of a bygone age - as well as comfort, care and convenience – rather than the impersonal, homogenized facilities promoted by the global tourism industry.
